paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the Val122Ile variant in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: congestive heart failure with LVEF 35%, progressive shortness of breath, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, orthopnea
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Further genetic sequencing analysis showed pathogenic Val122Ile mutation and confirmed familial ATTR cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with a late-onset amyloid cardiomyopathy characterized by progressive severe heart failure.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with familial ATTR cardiomyopathy.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was evaluated for heart and liver transplants but was deemed not a candidate due to increased pulmonary vascular resistance.
key_quotes: One of the most common mutations is caused by the Val122Ile mutation, which presents in three to four percent of the African-American and Afro-Caribbean populations.
Further genetic sequencing analysis showed pathogenic Val122Ile mutation and confirmed familial ATTR cardiomyopathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
